title: Miniature Portrait of Louis XVII (1785-1795)
provenance_text:
Downham collection. (Sold at Salter, Simpson, & Sons, Bury St. Edmond's, England). Purchased by Lady Darwin, August 28, 1917; Herbert Dupuy, Pittsburgh, PA [1]; gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1927. 
NOTES: [1] DuPuy notes that this item was purchased "by Lady Darwin" from the Salter, Simpson & Sons sale on August 28, 1917. However, it is not clear in what capacity Lady Darwin was acting, i.e. as DuPuy's agent, or as a collector in her own right. This is likely Lady Florence Henrietta Darwin, also known as Florence Henrietta Fisher and Florence Henrietta Maitland.
